entry.title: Compliance Monitoring Program Committee meets Jan. 18
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. — The Compliance Monitoring Program Committee will hold a virtual meeting Thursday, Jan. 18, from 9 to 11 a.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. The committee’s agenda includes:
CMP Long term outlook Follow-up items from previous meeting Long term study – Riparian rule selection discussion
The meeting is open to the public to attend online via Zoom. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 48 hours before the meeting by emailing adam.coble@odf.oregon.gov. The CMP Committee assists efforts to monitor compliance with Forest Practices Rules. The committee advises ODF regarding monitoring projects and procedures. View more information on the CMPC webpage.

entry.summary: State Senator David Brock Smith talks about priorities for the short session of the legislature next month, and other related topics: Click here to download for later listening; 830 1 8 24

entry.title: Monique DeSpain hosts meet & greet
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Monique DeSpain, a candidate running for Oregon fourth Congressional district, is hosting a meet and greet at 2 p.m. Saturday at Journey Roseburg on 1600 NE Diamond Lake Blvd.

entry.title: Person hospitalized following RV fire
entry.summary: YONCALLA — One resident was hospitalized following a fire that destroyed an RV in north county Saturday morning.

entry.title: Winter storm warning Tuesday to Wednesday afternoon
entry.summary: SOUTHERN OREGON — A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect from 1 a.m. Tuesday through 4 p.m. Wednesday for higher elevations in parts of the region.

entry.title: Roseburg to host geocaching kick-off event
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Parks and Recreation is inviting the public to become treasure hunters with the Discover Roseburg 13 Land of Umpqua Geocache Series.

entry.title: WINTER STORM WARNING EARLY TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: January 8, 2024 3:45 a.m. A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect from 1:00 a.m. Tuesday through 4:00 p.m. Wednesday for higher elevations in parts of the region. Forecasters said heavy snow and blowing snow is expected above 2,000 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches, with up to 24 inches possible over...

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL TO HAVE FIRST MEETING OF 2024
entry.summary: January 8, 2024 3:30 a,m. The Roseburg City Council will have its first meeting of 2024 on Monday night. Commission chair appointments and commission appointments will be made. The council president will be elected for the new year. Roseburg Public Library Director Kris Wiley will have a special presentation, reviewing the library, which celebrated its...

entry.title: CITY OF REEDSPORT WITH CITY COUNCIL VACANCY
entry.summary: January 8, 2024 3:20 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The City of Reedsport is accepting applications to fill a vacant city council position. The appointee’s term of office will begin at time of appointment and expire at the end of 2024. At the general election in November 2024, the position will be open for election...

entry.title: COMMISSIONER FREEMAN APPOINTED AS AOC’S WIR REPRESENTATIVE
entry.summary: January 8, 2024 3:10 a.m. Douglas County Commissioner Tim Freeman has recently been appointed by the Association of Oregon Counties as the Western Interstate Region Representative. A County release said the seat is placed by presidential appointment. This seat is also an AOC Board of Director seat, as part of AOC’s Legislative Committee. According to...
